1123431490979758082.text: "We suffer from the delusion that the entire universe is held in order by the categories of human thought, fearing that if we do not hold to them with the utmost tenacity, everything will vanish into chaos.” - Alan Watts

Condoms That Change Color In Contact with STD Win Tech Awardhttp://time.com/3935464/std-sensitive-condoms/ …

1123373492039077893.text: Poll: Have you watched Avengers: Endgame?

1123383811268431872.text: Acknowledging you’re surprised by a reaction and making efforts to understand and accommodate it is not the same as admitting you’re wrong. If it feels like it, it means you knew you were wrong all along.

1123435476306685952.text: There seems to be growing abuse of self-declared non-neurotypicality to excuse treating others badly, or worse people arbitrarily designated “neurotypicals” as unenlightened subhuman hive-mind drones who mistake your enlightened X-Men geniusing for assholery

1123440261131046919.text: My sympathies and benefit of doubt allocations here have swung around 180 degrees since this topic first popped in the zeitgeist. There’s just too clear a pattern in the kinds of people seeking accommodation, and the behaviors they want get-out-of-jail-free cards for.

1123441700867850242.text: And of course we all know actual non-neurotypicals who badly need accommodation will be the ones to suffer because of assholes trying to pass. Celiac’s sufferers vs fashionably gluten-free all over again.

1123437639435206656.text: If you’ll excuse my subhuman hyperneurotypical cognitive Luddism, I’ll wait till you actually create the next iPhone or prove P!=NP before according you the superhuman behavioral allowances you obviously deserve. I’ll even apologize for mistaking you for an ordinary asshole then.

1123457836204294144.text: “Extraordinary” is usually defined extrinsically with respect to a population (eg tall people) or an environment (exceptionally precise+fragile adaptive fit, like koalas and eucalyptus  leaves). I wonder if it could be intrinsically defined in terms of maintenance energy share

1123436516389326851.text: The handful of obviously outlier non-neurotypicals I know well personally, without exception, take great pains to avoid inadvertently hurting others. This makes me somehow skeptical of self-serving incivility. I have a nasty, suspicious mind that way.

1123383233452789760.text: Support or criticism from unexpected quarters are externalities. If you double down with no course change, you are condoning the former, denying the merit (and possibly locus standi) of the latter.

1123446861338152960.text:
I’m sort of commuter-skirmisher drive-by participant in the culture wars. 

I don’t have a culture-war beat. I just take  opportunistic shots if they present themselves, while switching between my main useless shitposting beats like marvel movies and mediocrity philosophy

1123469417126531072.text:
A few years ago, I developed a habit of prefixing a 0 (zero) to Gmail tags I wanted near the top of my list because they were active/current.

And of course I now have 16  0-prefixed tags so the list ends below the fold

1123443171718062082.text:
I’ve found it useful to treat other minds the same way I treat unfamiliar territories. I try to construct maps for individual territories. 

Is New York a more or less “typical” city than LA or Chicago?

Who cares? You can’t navigate one using maps for the other anyway.

1123456518421188609.text:
The mediocre shall inherit the earth

By definition

1123464994211889152.text: All extremism seems to arise from some vector of lack of self-awareness. It’s some sort of spiritual division by zero error.

1123429134053462016.text: “Non-neurotypical” is the new black turtleneck. Mark of misunderstood Jobsian genius.

1123390337936834561.text:
All externalities are one of 4 things: 

1. Plausibly deniable intended outcomes

2. Unexpected, but welcome (or tolerable) outcomes

3. Evidence of your cluelessness if you genuinely think you don't have any responsibility for them

4. Genuine surprises
